steps.action: Complete setup items if directed in the gitlab issue.
steps.title: Setup and create yyyy-mm-dd directory

steps.action: Make sure you have clone the ace3p-extensions repository, either https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmb/plugins/ace3p-extensions.git or git@gitlab.kitware.com:cmb/plugins/ace3p-extensions.git, and are using the current master branch.
steps.title: Clone ace3p-extensions repository
Maximize screen, Load project plugin, pull sidebar to 1/3 screen width

steps.expect: modelbuilder to open a directory browser dialog
steps.title: New project

steps.action: In that dialog, navigate to the test directory you created in the setup procedure and create a subdirectory <tt>t3p_cavity-quarter</tt>. Select the new subdirectory and click the OK.
steps.expect: modelbuilder to display a "Specify New Project" dialog with the "Workspace Directory" and "Name (Subdirectory)" fields set.
steps.title: New project directory yyyy-mm-dd/t3p_cavity-quarter.

steps.action: Set the "Simulation Template File" to the ACE3P template that is in the ace3p-extensions repository at <tt>simulation-workflows/ACE3P.sbt</tt>.
steps.title: Simulation template "ACE3P.sbt"

steps.action: Set the "Geometry File" to <tt>data/model/3d/netcdf/pillboxwg.ncdf</tt>. You will need to set the extension dropdown to "netcdf".
steps.title: Geometry model "pillboxwg.ncdf"

steps.expect: modelbuilder to close the dialog, then display the model geometry in the 3D view and update the Attribute Editor to display a "Modules" tab. On some systems, the model is not immediately displayed, but instead it appears when the "Resources" tab is selected. If that occurs, add a comment to the GitLab issue. Verify that there are two items listed in the "Resources" panel, labeled <tt>sbi.default</tt> and <tt>pillboxwg</tt>.
steps.title: Apply

steps.expect: modelbuilder "Output Messages" view to include "Saved Project".
steps.title: Save Project

steps.action:
• Select whether to record or play the test. In general, you should select PLAY if the xml file is available.
  • If you select PLAY, use the "Tools" => "Play Test..." menu item and navigate to the "t3p_cavity-quarter.xml" file.
  • If you select RECORD, use the "Tools" => "Record Test..." menu and specify "t3p_cavity-quarter.xml" as the file.
steps.title: Begin record/play t3p_cavity-quarter.xml

steps.action: In the Attribute Editor "Modules" tab, select "T3P".
steps.expect: Six tabs should appear in the Attribute Editor, labeled "Boundary Conditions", "Materials", "Analysis", "Beam Info", "Loading", and "Monitors".
steps.title: Select T3P module

steps.action:
Select the "Boundary Condition" tab, then
  1. Set surface 1 and 2 to Magnetic
  2. Set surface 3 and 4 to Absorbing
  3. Set surface 5 and 6 tp Exterior
steps.title: Boundary Conditions

steps.action:
Select the "Analysis" tab, then
  1. Change the "Linear Solver" dropdown to "MUMPS"
  2. Set the "Maximum Time (s)"" to 5e-09
  3. Set "Time Steps (s)"" to 2e-12
steps.title: Analysis

steps.action:
Select the "Beam Info" tab, then
  1. Click on the "New" button to create an attribute.
  2. In the editor section, set the "Bunch Type" to "Gaussian".
  3. (In the subpanel just beneath "Gaussian") Set "RMS Bunch Length (m)" to 0.01.
  4. Set "Number of Sigmas" to 5.
  5. Set the "Symmetry Factor" to 4.
  6. Set the "Charge (C)" to 1.0e-12.
  7. Set the "Starting Point (m)" to 0, 0, -0.075
  8. Set the "Source Boundary" to "surface 3"
steps.title: Beam Info

steps.action:
Select the "Monitor" tab, then
  1. Set the drop down menu to "Volume Monitor".
  2. Click the "New" button to create attribute.
  3. In the editor pane, the "Name" field should be blank and red - set it to "mymon"
  4. Set "Start Time (s)" to 0, "End Time (s)"" to 5e-09, and "Time Interval" to 1e-10.
In the same tab, change the drop down to "Wakefield Monitor" and click "New".
  1. Set the "Name" field to "wakefield"
  2. Set "Start Contour" to -0.075. "End Contour" to 0.075, "Max Distance" to 1.4.
In the same tab change the drop down to "Power Monitor" and click "New".
  1. Set the "Name" field to "power-monitor".
  2. Set the "Monitor Boundary" to "surface 5"
In the same tab, change the drop down to "Mode Voltage Monitor" and click "New".
  1. Set the "Name" field to "mode-voltage".
  2. Set the "Monitor Port" to "surface 6".
steps.title: Monitor settings

steps.action: If you are recording the test, click the "Stop Recording" button to save the xml script.
steps.title: Finish record/play

steps.action:
From the "Project" menu
  1. Select "Export Project" to open the "Simulation Export Dialog".
  2. Click the "Apply" button. Expect the dialog to close.
steps.title: Export

steps.action: Select the Project => Close Project menu item.
steps.expect: modelbuilder to clear both tabs ("Attribute Editor", "Resources") and the 3D display.
steps.title: Close Project
